column4: Im trying to make and install the latest stable kenrel from kernel.org, however after I install it a lot of things work very strangley
the ubuntu kernel has some patches that the vanilla kernel does not
yeah ive noticed that - I dont know how happy I am about that, I think that may be my only complaint about ubuntu
the patches are the reason I use ubuntu/debian, personally
im hoping thats the patched ubuntu kernel code
I can live with that then
apt-cache search linux-source in a terminal will get you going
got that already, just hadnt make my custom kernel for this yet
the whole device stack: udev, hal, etc depends on hotplug, which is the current module loader.
how do I keep so many modules from loading then?
look over the modules you have loaded, then use /etc/hotplug/blacklist to drop the ones you don't want. Hotplug is pretty smart on my machine
if an implementation is choking you, look for another.
